args: \dOkay. Where do you think we should start?\d
\dMm hmm... I mean, yes, that's right.\d
\dOoh... Do you know about editing and stuff?\nWe're going to need someone to help put\ntogether a promotional video and stuff.\d
\dYou mean for the stuff we recorded before?\d
\dRight. The stuff for next year's recruiting\ndrive.\d
\dNow that we've got all the footage we need,\nwe should start thinking about what we're\ngoing to do with it.\d
\dHotaru's new to the club, so she can give us\na good idea of what works best from an\noutsider's perspective.\d
\dIt's a lot to put on a new member right off\nthe bat, isn't it?\d
\dIt's just a suggestion. No one's going to\nforce her.\d
\dWe could work on it together if you prefer.\nThat would be a more conventional approach.\d
Hotaru drew in a small, determined breath.
\dThank you! You don't have to dedicate all\nyour time to it. Just think of this as a way\nto get familiar with the club.\d
\dOkay, if you're sure. Give it your best\nshot.\d
Hotaru nodded. Ageha was watching her closely.
She really was a lot more pro-active these\ndays.
\dWhat happened to all that enthusiasm you\nmustered up before?\d
\dIt seemed like a good idea, but...\d
\dI don't know if I can really do it...\d
I put my arm around Hotaru.
\dIt's easy to run low of steam now and then.\nTrust me I know.\d
\dDon't get discouraged just because you're not\nas confident now as you were back then.\d
\dYou'll get your second wind once you get\ngoing, trust me. You just have to take things\nin your stride.\d
\dWhen you're gliding, you can use a dip in\naltitude to re-accelerate.\d
\dAs long as you fly in the end, what happens\nin between doesn't matter too much.\d
\dJust give it a try, okay? It's not like the\nwhole club is going to go under if you don't\nproduce something award winning.\d
\dAnd I'll be here. Y'know, for moral support.\d
Hotaru leaned her head against me.
She looped her arm through mine.
\dIt's kind of hard to walk like this.\d
\dI'm sure I'll get used to it.\d
Awkwardness aside, I'd have been happy to walk\nwith Hotaru to the ends of the earth.
The next day, she began her work in earnest.
\dYes. I wanted everyone's opinion first so I\ncan think about what direction to take.\d
\dObviously, we want to emphasize the sky.\d
\dWe want to share the thrill of soaring\nthrough the sky with as many people as\npossible.\d
\dYou don't need any special knowledge to join.\nIt's more a coming together of people who love\nthe sky.\d
\dWe've got to work beauty into it, too.\d
\dLike when you fly over the lake for the first\ntime, and you're blown away by the beautiful\nview.\d
\dOr when you swoop across the sky and see all\nthe pure-white clouds close up. That really\nstayed with me, anyhow.\d
\dImagery is all well and good, but don't\nforget to include enough relevant info.\d
\dLike where we meet, what our activities\ninvolve... And of course, that we do flights\non weekends. That kind of thing.\d
\dSince we're a specialist school and all, you\nmight want to bring up glider construction to\nbring in more people like Ageha.\d
\dI don't think I can add anything of value to\nthis discussion.\d
\dI'd still like to get everyone's opinion.\d
\dWe could use the glider itself as a symbol of\nthe club.\d
\dWe made it ourselves. It's like the\ncrystallization of all our efforts.\d
\dIt might be a good marketing point. It's our\nown handmade set of wings.\d
\dYeah, I've been thinking about how to get new\nstudents interested, too...\d
\dThe glider's important, but I'd also like to\nintroduce the club's members.\d
\dEven if I'm the one piloting, I'm never alone\nin this club.\d
\dIt's the first place I've seen so many people\nwork together. Building the glider, making\nrepairs, flight support, everything.\d
\dSo I think everyone should be featured in our\nvideo. That includes you too, Hotaru.\d
\dFor me, it's the joy of creating.\d
\dThe glider itself is great, but there's also\nplanning everything out, exploring new\npossibilities, getting the materials...\d
\dAll those little things add up over time.\nIt's what makes the process of building\nsomething so rewarding.\d
\dThat's part of the school spirit, too. The\nrobotics club usually stresses that during\ntheir recruitment, too.\d
\dWhat's your take on this place, Hotaru?\d
\dI bet you're gonna cram in something like, 'I\nlearned to fly a glider and got a boyfriend!'\nAm I right?\d
\dI wouldn't do anything like that. You're so\nmean sometimes!\d
\dBut you've heard what everyone thinks now,\nright?\d
\dBut your opinion's just as important, don't\nyou think?\d
\dKotori did recommend you for the job so you\ncould give us a newcomer's perspective on the\nclub.\d
\dYou may as well do whatever you want with\nthis. There's plenty of time, so we can always\nfix it if you're not satisfied.\d
\dYou can always ask me if you need help. I'm\nsure that goes for Aoi, too.\d
Maybe this was too much pressure to put on her\nso soon after she just joined.
But now that she'd stepped up to the\nchallenge, I hoped she'd see it through to the\nend.
I'd have to do my part as her boyfriend to\nsupport her, too.
This weekend, I'd fly for sure.
Gotta show off my good points for my\ngirlfriend now and then!
My leg didn't hurt anymore, but I made a point\nof taking walks around the neighborhood in the\nmornings to warm up a little.
When I got back, she was right there at the\ndorm entrance.
And just to prove it, I jumped into the air.
This would have been a really bad time for the\npain to come back.
But I landed just fine and feeling great.
\dWant me to carry you over the threshold?\d
\dWhat? Hey, slow down! No, you can't--\d
\dI'll let you off the hook for some head\npats.\d
\dI actually wouldn't mind...if you did... Just\na little, I mean...\d
Her voice trailed off as her face got more and\nmore red.
I wished I could whisk her into my arms and\ncarry her into the dorm like the princess she\nwas.
That might not be the best idea now, though...\nI settled for a surprise kiss.
Hotaru's face burned bright red, her eyes\nmisted over, and for a moment it looked like I\nmight actually have to catch her in my arms.
I opted for just holding her up by the\nshoulders.
She shook her head as if to clear it, then\nleaned gently into my chest.
\dI had a dream about you last night...\d
Hotaru stepped away, still trying to hide her\nblushing, and headed on into the dorm.
\dAoi, you should go get changed for school. I\ncan get a start on breakfast while you get\nready.\d
\dThanks. I'll try not to take too long.\d
Just needed to throw on my uniform...
The two of us set to work making breakfast.
On today's menu was natto with white rice,\nmiso soup, and stir-fried ham and veggies.
\dWe were alone, just the two of us, and...\nWell, it felt really nice. I was really\nhappy...\d
Maybe we did something in that dream she was\ntoo embarrassed to tell me about now...
\dBut then, just when things were getting\nreally good, everyone else showed up.\d
\dYou mean Ageha, Kotori, and the others?\d
\dOkay. Not just them, but Tatsuya and Masa,\ntoo.\d
\dMore and more people kept showing up, and I\nlost you in the crowd...\d
\dI don't know a lot about dream\ninterpretation, so take my opinion with a\ngrain of salt...\d
\dBut maybe this is one of those dreams with a\ncontradictory meaning?\d
\dHuh...? You think it means the opposite of\nwhat happened?\d
\dExactly. And I'll prove it to you, all\nthrough today.\d
I had a feeling everyone else was starting to\nwake up, but none of them had come to\nbreakfast yet.
Hotaru looked around too, just to make sure.
She turned her face toward me pleadingly.
Now was our best chance. I leaned forward...
I touched my lips to Hotaru's.
Hotaru shivered like she'd been dealt a 200\nvolt shock.
Oh, the taste of those sweet, voluptuous\nlips...
I put my hand on her cheek as we kissed again.
Slowly, I moved my face away.
Hotaru was trembling like her bones had been\nturned to jelly.
I wasn't sure if that had been a 'yes' or a\n'no.'
\dNo! Geez, have some control. I'm fine, I\nbelieve you!\d
Watching Hotaru squirm was making my heart\nrace.
Maybe there was time for another kiss... Maybe\na deeper, more intimate one this time...
It looked like Hotaru had picked up on what I\nwas planning. She closed her eyes and waited.
Yuka and the others all arrived shortly after.
\dI have no idea what you're talking about...\d
If you play sports, sometimes you'll come up\nagainst someone you instinctively know you\nhave no chance against.
It was the same thing with Kanako. I could\nfeel it in my bones. This was not a new\nrevelation or anything.
Ageha showed up after breakfast right as we\nwere getting ready to leave.
Like usual, we all headed to school together.
Hotaru kept almost completely silent until we\nwere a few minutes away from school.
\dIs it okay if I don't come to the club\nmeeting today...?\d
\dThat shouldn't be a problem. Is there\nsomewhere else you need to be?\d
\dI was thinking of using one of the labs in\nthe main campus...\d
She was really serious about this.
\dIt's good to see Hotaru raring to go again.\d
\dHas she told you what she's planning to do?\d
\dNope. She's keeping it all under wraps for\nnow.\d
\dGuess we'll just have to wait till it's\nfinished.\d
Now that Hotaru was feeling properly\nmotivated, there wasn't much more I could do\nfor her.
If I was feeling cocky I might say our kiss\nthat morning had dispelled her doubts and\nallowed her to properly focus.
Being in a relationship has its advantages.
The rest was up to her.
We all worked together to reassemble the\nglider from its separate parts.
It was finally time for my triumphant return.
We'd done this so many times before, we had\nthe process down pat by now.
Even after all this time, seeing those white\nwings waiting on the runway still filled me\nwith an indescribable thrill.
The skies were clear. It was the perfect day\nfor a flight.
I helped Kotori into the rear set.
\dAre you sure you can do it?\d
I called Hotaru over and ruffled her hair.
\dThink you can grab some drinks for when we\nget back?\d
\dIt's a very important job. I'm counting on\nyou.\d
I climbed into the cockpit and closed the\ncanopy.
\dHello, can you hear me? We're gonna run the\nchecks, okay?\d
Man, it had been a while. It felt good to be\nback in the cockpit.
We got through the standard checks and were\nready for takeoff in no time.
I figured I should at least wave to Hotaru\nbefore setting off.
One countdown later, the winch cord was\ntightened and the glider moved into action.
I sat back, felt the change in Gs, and soon\nall I could see from the canopy was blue\nskies.
The sky was always an inspiring sight. This\nwas the greatest.
I took full advantage of that flight, doing my\nbest to make up for missing last week.
Right now I was the only one in the club with\na pilot license. We'd need some of the other\nmembers to qualify before I graduated.
I wanted to share this wonderful experience\nwith Hotaru. And if possible, get her used to\noperating the glider, too.
After flying around a while longer, I came in\nto land.
According to the schedule we'd drawn up, Asa\nwould be riding with me next.
Hotaru stood there, holding a couple of\nplastic drinks bottles.
She hesitantly handed me some mineral water.
I took it, glad to have something to quench my\nthirst.
I put my free hand around Hotaru's shoulder.
Hotaru's eyes teared up just a little.
She looked away for a moment, then turned back\nto face me with a sunny smile.
That pain in my knee had actually worked out\nfor the best in the end.
If that hadn't happened, Hotaru might never\nhave told me how she felt.
Not that I could ever say to her I was\ngrateful I got hurt.
This feeling would just have to be my secret.
\dRight? It's really something, even if you're\nonly watching.\d
It was nice to know we were on the same page.
\dThe air currents are all pretty stable today,\nso it's a great day for flying.\d
\dYou're a member of this club now. You're just\nas entitled to a turn as anyone.\d
\dI'd really like to show you what it's like to\nfly.\d
\dPlus, it's your duty, as a member of the\nsoaring club!\d
\dWe'd better go through some of the basic\ncontrols. Nobody flies alone, be sure to\nremember that.\d
\dIt's one of our club's most sacred laws.\nUnderstand?\d
Soon enough, it was time for me and Hotaru to\nfly together.
\dDon't worry about it. It's a little rough\ntaking off, but after that it's smooth\nsailing.\d
\dI'd say it's less stressful than a roller coaster.\d
\dThere aren't any wild winds today, so we\nshouldn't shake around much.\d
\dYou can just sit back and enjoy the ride.\d
\dEverything's fine on our side. How are you\nguys doing?\d
\dHotaru, can you hear me? Have fun on your\nfirst flight! Tell me all about it when you\nget back!\d
With that, the two of us launched into the\nwild blue yonder.
The sun was starting to go down, bathing the\nsky and the land below in a myriad of colors.
Flying at night wasn't a good idea, so this\nwould be our last flight of the day.
Hotaru's face was practically glued to the\ncanopy, her eyes drinking in every last detail\nof the twilit sky.
\dYou can see the ocean from here, too.\d
\dOne sec, I think I can take us higher...\d
\dDon't forget to look above us, too.\d
The sight of the evening sky.
It was a vast expanse of darkening purple.\nStars were starting to appear, looking\nbrighter than they ever did from the ground.
These colors we were seeing now were unlike\nanything on earth.
The weather and the time of day had all come\ntogether to create the best possible scenery.
On the horizon, the mountains burned crimson,\nand below us, the lake surface shimmered in\nthe dying light.
Everywhere we looked, the world dazzled us\nwith its beauty.
\dI'm so glad. We got to fly together!\d
\dWe're gonna fly together plenty from now on,\nyou know.\d
Now that I'd said that, I felt my face going\nred.
\dD-don't look at me. I didn't think about how\nsentimental that was going to sound...\d
I didn't turn around to look, but I could tell\nHotaru was laughing, and maybe wiping a tear\nfrom her eye.
\dYeah. We'll explore this great vast sky,\ntogether.\d
\dIt looks great during the day, too. When you\nget above the clouds, all you can hear is the\nwind.\d
\dIt's like you're becoming one with the sky\nitself...\d
\dOh, uh... Sorry. I got carried away. That\nsounded really corny, right?\d
\dI'm starting to really love the sky.\d
\dI can't wait to fly with you some more...\d
If there hadn't been those seats between us,\nit would have been the perfect chance to turn\naround for a kiss.
I could hear Hotaru fiddling around with\nsomething in the seat behind me.
\dYou think you're ready to support me with\nyour controls?\d
\dNo buts about it. I know you can do this.\d
\dIf you think I can, I'll give it my best...!\d
Hotaru stretched out her hand and touched my\nhead.
I put my hand over hers and lightly stroked\nit.
We reduced our altitude just fine, and came in\nfor a smooth landing.
\dThere, back on land. You did a great job.\d
\dDid it make you fall for Aoi all over again?\d
\dDidn't you take this opportunity to make all\nkinds of romantic promises and junk?\d
\dYou can't fool me. I bet 'Ooh, isn't it\npretty' is like your code word for 'I love\nyou.'\d
\dWhy would we even need code words?\d
\dIt's so much more romantic that way, don't\nyou think?\d
\dEven if your relationship's not a secret,\nit's nice having words that hold a special\nmeaning for the two of you, isn't it?\d
\dIt brings you closer together, cements your\nexistence as a couple.\d
\dIn fact, just having words that are special\nto the two of you is as much a sign of love as\nanything else. A big sister knows these things.\d
\dHeheh... So what was that about 'flying\nplenty together from now on,' huh?\d
\dCut it out! How do you know all that?\d
Our mics weren't even connected when we said\nall that. Had Ageha been bugging the glider?!
\dThere's no way you could have heard that on\nyour own. What's going on here?!\d
\dIt'd be boring if I just told you.\d
\dCan you solve this little mystery? Or has the\nmighty quizmaster confounded you?\d
\dHotaru, go look in the glider! And don't let\nAgeha touch it.\d
I guess getting messed with like this was the\nprice we paid for Ageha's technical skills.
Gliding was never a 100\p safe thing, so it was\ngreat having someone on the ground who'd know\nwhat to do if things went south, but...
\dWe'll find out how you did this for sure!\d
Hotaru and I went over the glider from nose to\ntail, inside and out.
\dNext time, I'll reveal one of her secrets and\nsee how funny she thinks it is...\d
\dYeah, that'll teach her. She's not gonna tell\nus how she did this on her own anytime soon.\d
We were going to need time to lick our wounds\non this one...
Hotaru had finished the video and poster\nadvertising the club to new students.
The whole club had gathered together today to\ntake a look at them.
\dWhat kind of approach did she go for?\d
Kotori tried to get some info out of me while\nHotaru was setting up.
\dShe didn't tell me. This'll be my first time\nseeing it, too.\d
\dI can't wait to offer some 'constructive\ncriticism.' Heheh...\d
\dI guess it's good she has you there at home\nto help if we decide it needs fixing.\d
\dHave a little more faith in your sister.\d
I was pretty confident the content wasn't\ngoing to be a problem.
The fact that this was a labor of love on\nHotaru's part was enough for me.
The whole room held its breath at the moment\nof the grand unveiling.
\dA-as an underclassman, I feel it's not my\nbusiness to comment on the behavior of my\nelders...\d
Hotaru couldn't keep still, she was so\nnervous.
\dYou tried to cram a lot in, it looks a little\ntoo cluttered.\d
That didn't really answer the question...
\dHmm... You, Himegi the Younger. I think some\nadjustments need to be made.\d
\dI mean, you put in stuff about the glider,\nclub activities, our schedule, our members,\njust like we asked, but...\d
\dThere's so much to take in, your average\nstudent in the hall probably won't stop long\nenough to give it a chance.\d
\dYou did ask us all for our input. I think\nit's good you tried to use every idea we came\nup with.\d
\dIt's just...we only have so much space to\nwork with, so I think you should slim it\ndown.\d
\dYou can probably just ignore the suggestions\nfrom me and Aoi, that'll help to streamline it\nfor a start.\d
\dWe still have plenty of time, so you can try\ndifferent things. If you still can't decide\nwhat to cut, I can give you some advice.\d
The meeting broke up with everyone still\nfeeling a little awkward.
Amane went home, as did the Kozato sisters.
That left me, Hotaru, Kotori, and Ageha to\nhead back to the dorm.
\dYou girls planning to stay for dinner?\d
\dHey, lighten up. It's not the end of the\nworld.\d
\dShe's right. It's not like this was a contest\nyou've been disqualified from. You can just\ntry again if you want.\d
\dWe can look at what you made already and talk\nabout how to improve it. Isn't that a good\nthing?\d
\dI think we should head home for today.\d
I tried to cheer her up with a goodbye\nhead pat.
Needless to say, it didn't do much to lift her\nmood.
It didn't even get a fake smile out of her.
Ageha and Kotori both stared daggers at me. I\nguess I shouldn't have expected to be able to\ncheer Hotaru up so easily.
If I couldn't make an effort at a time like\nthis, what kind of boyfriend was I?
I went back to my room, changed into some more\ncomfy clothes, and after enough time had\npassed, called Hotaru.
Or rather...I picked up my cell phone, but\nbefore I could call--
\dOh, hi. I was just about to call you.\d
\dAoi... Can I come see you later?\d
\dSure, just give me some time. I'll come get\nyou.\d
There was only so much we could say on the\nphone. Talking in person was a better idea.
After dinner, I tidied up a little and left.
I rode my bike along the night-time streets.
The wind was nice and cool.
Summer would soon be giving way to fall.
I called Hotaru again, and a few minutes later\nshe emerged from the front door of her house.
Hotaru's bike was a cute little thing. She\nrode it a lot, and it really suited her.
Without further ado, we rode off into the\nnight together. It was kinda nice.
I slowed down a little to match my pace with\nHotaru's.
\dSomewhere big and open would be good...\d
We left the lights of the town behind and\ncycled toward the lake.
I opened up the door to the hangar. I always\ncarried the key with me just in case.
Hotaru slumped into my waiting arms.
She felt really hot. I guessed we'd both\nworked up quite a sweat getting here.
\dIt might've been better to come here at a\ncolder time of year.\d
She nuzzled her face into my chest.
I felt a warm sensation on my cheek a moment\nlater.
I put an arm around Hotaru and gently stroked\nher back.
I wished she could always be that happy.
We stayed that way for a while, wrapped in\neach other's body heat, taking time for an\noccasional kiss.
I won't lie, part of me wished we could go\neven further... But I had more important\nthings to do at the time.
I think she could tell where this was going\nfrom the tone of my voice.
\dI was really surprised everyone didn't like\nyour stuff more...\d
\dThat's not what you want me to say, right?\d
\dI understand you better than you think.\d
\dYeah... I know what I made wasn't that\ngreat...\d
\dEven in class, my projects don't get a lot of\npraise or anything.\d
\dMy teachers are always reminding me about how\ntalented my sister is.\d
\dAgeha does have a lot going for her.\d
Complimenting other girls at a time like this\nmight be something of a faux pas, but Ageha\nwas a special exception.
\dThere's one thing the teachers who like Ageha\nalways say to me...\d
I didn't say anything, just continued to hold\nHotaru and wait for her to finish in her own\ntime.
\dI'm always trying to use too many ideas at\nthe same time...\d
\dWhen I told Ageha about that, she only\nlaughed and said it must run in the family...\d
\dShe said she wants to play around with\neverything she can, too.\d
\dI don't think it's the same thing, though.\d
\dI think it's more... I have trouble\ndeciding...\d
\dIf I've got two things to choose from I can\nnever commit to just one...\d
\dIf one choice is obviously better, that's not\na problem. But if they've both got good\npoints, then...\d
\dSo you end up trying to use both, right?\d
\dI'd love to say I try to include the best\npoints of both, but it's more like I just\ncan't bear to give any of them up...\d
Ageha and I were partly to blame for Hotaru's\nindecisive streak.
We'd always been the ones to decide where to\ngo and what to play.
Whether it was swimming in the lake or hiding\naway in our secret base, we made the decision\nand Hotaru just went along with it.
When it came to food, too, we'd buy whatever\nwe wanted and share it with her.
Toys, games, cards, the list went on. We never\nexcluded Hotaru, but we were always the ones\nin control.
When we got a little older we started to split\ninto girls and boys groups, but even then she\nlet Ageha take the lead...
\dBut I know you've been trying to change that\nabout yourself, too.\d
\dBut I have been making an effort to make my\nown suggestions and decisions...\d
I lightly caressed her cheek to emphasize that\nsentiment.
Hotaru smiled, bringing her hand up to meet\nmine.
\dIt's thanks to you that I was finally able to\ntake this step...to really put my heart into\nimproving myself.\d
\dIt wasn't just for my own sake. I thought I\nwas becoming more like the kind of girl you\ndeserve, little by little...\d
\dBut when I tried making the promotional\nmaterial...\d
\dIt felt like maybe I hadn't changed all that\nmuch after all.\d
\dI couldn't come up with something good on my\nown.\d
\dI tried not to exclude anyone's ideas, and\nput everything in.\d
\dI'm still the same old indecisive girl I\nalways have been...!\d
Hotaru clung tighter to me as her eyes began\nto fill with tears.
I had to get serious about comforting her this\ntime.
I tenderly stroked her back and patted her\nhead until she calmed down.
*sniff* \dI thought I'd be able to stick to my\nguns when it counted, but...\d
\dI was just so scared... There was so much\nthat felt important, I just kept adding and\nadding and couldn't drop any ideas...\d
I stroked Hotaru's back, in silence this time.
It was better not to break her flow until\nshe'd said everything she wanted to say.
Hotaru didn't speak for a while, but I think\nshe was glad just to have me there.
\dAoi... Don't you ever have this kind of\nproblem?\d
\dTo be honest, making decisions has never\nreally been a problem for me.\d
\dWith both cycling and gliding, you can't\nafford to hesitate over things for very long.\d
\dBut is it scary when you have to make those\nchoices?\d
\dBut not making a choice, giving up my control\nof a situation, that's even scarier.\d
\dWhatever the outcome, I want to know I did\neverything I could.\d
\dThat's why I know my successes and failures\nare my own, no one else's. That way, no one\ncan take them away from me.\d
\dIt's easy to put the blame on your opponents,\nyour equipment, the weather, stuff like that.\d
\dBut I think you lose something important by\nshifting the responsibility onto others like\nthat.\d
\dMaking and learning from your own mistakes is\na good way to grow, both in body and mind.\d
\dThat's the way I try to live my life, anyway.\nIt helps me get through the day.\d
\dAnd that way I feel like I'm getting closer\nto being the person I want to be.\d
\dWell, so are you. I've seen your strength for\nmyself.\d
\dYeah. You've managed to stay positive and\nkeep up your efforts to change all this time.\d
\dIt's fine to feel disappointed, but I think\nit's important not to give up and keep trying\nto change whatever you can.\d
\dAnd I believe you're capable of doing that.\nSo you don't have to worry, okay?\d
A smile finally broke through her gloom.
But it was buried a moment later by a heavy\nsigh.
\dI wanted to be a more decisive kind of girl\nthat could keep herself together... I thought\nyou'd like me better that way...\d
\dI like you plenty the way you are now.\d
\dI want you to like me more and more.\d
\dI want you to like me just as much as I like\nyou.\d
\dI dunno, I really do like you a lot.\d
\dYou just don't understand. You don't know how\ncrazy huge my love for you is.\d
\dI'm pretty sure I love you more than anyone\nin the world.\d
